keyTakeAways: A Slovak court sentenced Juraj Cintula to 21 years in prison for attempting to assassinate Prime Minister Robert Fico in May 2024.
Cintula, a 72-year-old former mine worker, stonemason, writer, and public activist, shot at Fico five times from a distance of just over 1 meter.
The court ruled that Cintula committed terrorism, not just murder or assault, citing his intent to target the Prime Minister specifically.
Fico, who was seriously injured, has returned to public life and work, with ongoing health issues linked to the attack.
The attack highlighted deep societal divisions between populist Fico and liberal, pro-EU opposition parties in Slovakia.
Cintula claimed he wanted to stop Fico's policies, which he believed damaged Slovak freedom and culture, and described the attack as a 'scream against fear'.
The defense argued that not all attacks on officials are terrorism, but the court found the attack to be politically motivated terrorism.
Fico has expressed forgiveness toward Cintula, despite the severity of the incident.
The verdict reflects the broader tensions in Slovak politics, particularly over democracy, media freedom, and foreign policy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Slovak court sentenced 72-year-old Juraj Cintula to 21 years in prison for attempting to assassinate Prime Minister Robert Fico in May 2024 during a public event in Handlova. Cintula, a former mine worker and public activist, shot Fico five times from a distance of just over one meter, injuring him seriously. The court ruled the act was terrorism, not just a violent attack, citing Cintula’s targeted intent against the Prime Minister. The verdict, delivered by Judge Igor Kralik in Banska Bystrica, reflects deep political and societal divisions in Slovakia, particularly between Fico’s populist, pro-Moscow policies and the liberal, pro-EU opposition. Fico, who has continued in office since the attack, has expressed forgiveness toward Cintula. The case has sparked national debate over political violence, media freedom, democratic standards, and the use of terrorism charges in political confrontations.
title: Slovakia Court Sentences Suspect in Attempted Assassination of Prime Minister Robert Fico to 21 Years
